title: 107_s2884
content: The Act is titled the "Maximum Economic Growth for America through Investment in Rural, Elderly, and Disabled Transit Act" or the "MEGA RED TRANS Act". It establishes a minimum level of funding for elderly and disabled programs. Section 5310 of title 49, United States Code is amended to ensure each State receives a minimum amount annually from the apportioned funds, with the option to use the funds for operating assistance. The amendment to Section 5310 of title 49, United States Code ensures each State receives a minimum amount annually from the apportioned funds for transportation services to elderly individuals and individuals with disabilities. SEC. 3. MINIMUM LEVEL OF FUNDING FOR RURAL PROGRAM. Section 5311 of title 49, United States Code is amended to ensure that each of the 50 States receives a minimum apportionment of $5,000,000 for fiscal years 2004-2006 and $5,500,000 for fiscal years 2007-2009. Additionally, the amount made available for the program established by this section in each of fiscal years 2004 through 2009 shall not be less than the amount allocated for all States for fiscal year 2003. For fiscal years 2004-2006, states that received less than $5,000,000 in fiscal year 2003 will receive the difference as additional funding. For fiscal years 2007-2009, states that received less than $5,500,000 in fiscal year 2003 will receive the difference as additional funding. SEC. 4. ESSENTIAL BUS SERVICE. The Secretary will establish a program for States to provide essential bus service between rural areas and airports or intercity rail stations. Eligible activities include planning, marketing, capital grants for facilities, and operating grants for bus transportation. The program established by the Secretary aims to enhance connections between bus service, commercial air passenger service, and intercity passenger rail service. Funds made available for this program shall remain available until expended and shall be apportioned to the States in the same proportion as under section 5311. Specific amounts are allocated for the implementation of this program for fiscal years 2004 to 2009. For fiscal years 2007, 2008, and 2009, $35,000,000 each year is allocated for the implementation of the program established by the Secretary to enhance connections between bus, air passenger, and rail services. SEC. 5. Minimum level of funding for urbanized areas with a population of less than 200,000 is set at $35,000,000 for fiscal years 2007, 2008, and 2009. Minimum Apportionment amendment in Title 49, US Code ensures urbanized areas in States collectively receive at least $5,000,000 annually for fiscal years 2004-2006 and $5,500,000 for fiscal years 2007-2009. The amendment in Title 49, US Code ensures that urbanized areas in States receive a minimum of $5,000,000 annually for fiscal years 2004-2006 and $5,500,000 for fiscal years 2007-2009. SEC. 6. LEVEL PLAYING FIELD FOR GOVERNMENT SHARE. Amends Chapter 53 of title 49, United States Code to establish the Government share of eligible transit project costs. SEC. 7. INTEREST CREDITED TO MASS TRANSIT ACCOUNT. SEC. 7. Interest credited to Mass Transit Account: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to ensure that interest accruing on the Mass Transit Account balance is credited to the account after September 30, 2003.
